page.title: 04B'NESS/SOLWAY.HISTORY - 1603
page.content: Recent research indicates pre-historic habitation. The Roman fort of MAIA, A.D.122 was Hadrian's Wall's most westerly garrison. It covered 7 acres and housed a Milliary Cohort of Auxiliaries. Bowness has commanded a crossing to Galloway since ancient times. During the Dark Ages,Romano- Britons were subject to invasion & settlement by the Saxons, Danes & Vikings. From A.D. 945-1157 Cumbria was ruled by the Scottish Crown, hence its omission from the original Domesday Book. After reversion to English rule, Edward 1 added a defensive rampart to the North face of the village guarding the ford. His legacy was 3 centuries of Border feuds which continued until some 40 years after the Union of the Scottish and English crowns in 1603.
